snippet: After natural disasters last year and dreadful reviews of the revamped Civic, Honda is struggling to return to its former success.
abstract: Honda is trying to recover from its troubles in 2011, when a series of natural disasters in Asia caused sales to plunge, and an important model, the revamped Civic, got such a poor reception that the company rushed to make changes; firm broke a string of eight consecutive monthly sales declines in United States with an 8.8 percent increase in January; its market share fell to 9 percent in 2011, from 10.6 percent in 2010.
lead_paragraph: After natural disasters last year and dreadful reviews of the revamped Civic, Honda is struggling to return to its former success.

headline.main: Honda Aims to Reclaim Its Luster
